qas.question: When did the Slavic solidarity movement choose red blue and white as their colors?
In what year did the nation of George get a new national flag?
What is in the middle of the Georgian flag?
How many small crosses are on the Georgian flag?
What were the Pan-Slavic colors originally?

answers.text: the colors of the Russian flag

qas.question: What colors were adopted by the Pan solidarity movement?
When did the Pan solidarity movement take place?
Why do Georgia and Poland use red on their flags?
What color flag did the Czech Republic adopt in 2004?

context: <b5_0>Red, blue, and white<b5_0/> are also the Pan-Slavic colors adopted by the Slavic solidarity movement of <a0_0>the <b6_0>late nineteenth century<b6_0/><a0_0/>. Initially these were <a4_0>the colors of the Russian flag<a4_0/>; as the Slavic movement grew, they were adopted by other Slavic peoples including Slovaks, Slovenes, and Serbs. The flags of the Czech Republic and Poland use red <b7_0>for historic heraldic reasons<b7_0/> (see Coat of arms of Poland and Coat of arms of the Czech Republic) & not due to Pan-Slavic connotations. In <a1_0>2004<a1_0/> Georgia adopted a new <b8_0>white<b8_0/> flag, which consists of <a3_0>four<a3_0/> small and <a2_0>one big red cross<a2_0/> in the middle touching all four sides.
